channel.title: CTRL SHIFT CLICK Teleporting?
channel.description: [code]src\server\model\players\packets\Walking.java:102: error: incomparable types: bo olean and int if (c.clickToTeleport == 1) ^ Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 1 error Press any key to continue . . .[/code]

item.title: CTRL SHIFT CLICK Teleporting?
item.dc:creator: @Pest Pest
item.description:
@Pest wrote:

sweet man, it’s working now.
thank you :]

Read full topic

item.title: CTRL SHIFT CLICK Teleporting?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Pest, post:7, topic:554207”]im so dumb :palm:
I followed this snippet; http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/google/snippets/517113-click-teleport.html
I’ve attempted to make the statement, both true and false, and it’s still not working. when i try the command, it says “click teleporting is: disabled” every time, but I’m not getting an error anymore.[/quote]
It working, and it compiling, are two different things.

The person who made the command… Well they made it weird.
Here’s a better version of it:

if (playerCommand.startsWith("clicktele")) { c.clickToTeleport = !c.clickToTeleport; c.sendMessage("Click teleporting is: " + (c.clickToTeleport ? "Enabled" : "Disabled")); }

Read full topic

item.title: CTRL SHIFT CLICK Teleporting?
item.dc:creator: @Pest Pest
item.description:
@Pest wrote:

im so dumb :palm:
I followed this snippet; http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs2-server/snippets/517113-click-teleport.html
I’ve attempted to make the statement, both true and false, and it’s still not working. when i try the command, it says “click teleporting is: disabled” every time, but I’m not getting an error anymore.

Read full topic

item.title: CTRL SHIFT CLICK Teleporting?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Pest, post:5, topic:554207”]did i declare
private int firstStepX;
private int firstStepY;
in the wrong place?[/quote]
It has nothing to do with that.
Read what I said again.

You are comparing a boolean, which has 2 states (false) and (true) against an integer (1). A boolean cannot be compared an integer, because an integer is not a valid state for a boolean.

Read full topic

item.title: CTRL SHIFT CLICK Teleporting?
item.dc:creator: @Pest Pest
item.description:
@Pest wrote:

did i declare
private int firstStepX;
private int firstStepY;
in the wrong place?

Read full topic

item.title: CTRL SHIFT CLICK Teleporting?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Yes. I get that.
Your error is because you’re comparing the boolean (c.clickToTeleport) with an int (1).
As I said earlier:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:2, topic:554207”]A boolean cannot be an int
You need to check if it’s true:

if (c.clickToTeleport == true) // or this if (c.clickToTeleport)
or if it is false:

if (c.clickToTeleport == false) // or this if (!c.clickToTeleport) [/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: CTRL SHIFT CLICK Teleporting?
item.dc:creator: @Pest Pest
item.description:
@Pest wrote:

i followed a snippet on RS, and this happened.

this is my Walking.java

[code]package server.model.players.packets;

import server.Server;
import server.model.players.Client;
import server.model.players.PacketType;

/**

  • Walking packet
    **/
    public class Walking implements PacketType {
    private int firstStepX;
    private int firstStepY;

    @Override
    public void processPacket(Client c, int packetType, int packetSize) {
    if (packetType == 248 || packetType == 164) {
    c.faceUpdate(0);
    c.npcIndex = 0;
    c.playerIndex = 0;
    if (c.followId > 0 || c.followId2 > 0 || c.follow2 > 0)
    c.getPA().resetFollow();
    }
    c.fishing = false;

     if(!c.isBanking && !c.inTrade) {
 c.getPA().removeAllWindows();
 c.startAnimation(65535);
 }
 if (c.isBanking)
 	c.isBanking = false;
 	if (c.storing)
 	c.storing = false;
 if (c.isShopping)
 	c.isShopping = false;
 if(c.duelRule[1] && c.duelStatus == 5) {
 	if(Server.playerHandler.players[c.duelingWith] != null) { 
 		if(!c.goodDistance(c.getX(), c.getY(), Server.playerHandler.players[c.duelingWith].getX(), Server.playerHandler.players[c.duelingWith].getY(), 1) || c.attackTimer == 0) {
 			c.sendMessage("Walking has been disabled in this duel!");
 		}
 	}
 	c.playerIndex = 0;	
 	return;		
 }
 				if(c.inTrade) {
 	return;
 }
 
 if(c.freezeTimer > 0) {
 	if(Server.playerHandler.players[c.playerIndex] != null) {
 		if(c.goodDistance(c.getX(), c.getY(), Server.playerHandler.players[c.playerIndex].getX(), Server.playerHandler.players[c.playerIndex].getY(), 1) && packetType != 98) {
 			c.playerIndex = 0;	
 			return;
 		}
 	}
 	if (packetType != 98) {
 		c.sendMessage("A magical force stops you from moving.");
 		c.playerIndex = 0;
 	}	
 	return;
 }
 
 if (System.currentTimeMillis() - c.lastSpear < 4000) {
 	c.sendMessage("You have been stunned.");
 	c.playerIndex = 0;
 	return;
 }
 
 if (packetType == 98) {
 	c.mageAllowed = true;
 	c.fishing = false;
 }
 		if (c.sit == true) {
 	c.sendMessage("::unsit before you can start walking again!");
 	return;
 }
 
 if((c.duelStatus >= 1 && c.duelStatus <= 4) || c.duelStatus == 6) {
 	if(c.duelStatus == 6) {
 		c.getTradeAndDuel().claimStakedItems();		
 	}
 	return;
 }
 
 
 if(c.respawnTimer > 3) {
 	return;
 }
 if(c.inTrade) {
 	return;
 }
 if(packetType == 248) {
 	packetSize -= 14;
 }
 c.newWalkCmdSteps = (packetSize - 5)/2;
 if(++c.newWalkCmdSteps > c.walkingQueueSize) {
 	c.newWalkCmdSteps = 0;
 	return;
 }
 
 c.getNewWalkCmdX()[0] = c.getNewWalkCmdY()[0] = 0;
 
  if (c.clickToTeleport == 1)
 	firstStepX = c.getInStream().readSignedWordBigEndianA();
 else
 	firstStepX = c.getInStream().readSignedWordBigEndianA()-c.getMapRegionX()*8;
 for(int i = 1; i < c.newWalkCmdSteps; i++) {
 	c.getNewWalkCmdX()[i] = c.getInStream().readSignedByte();
 	c.getNewWalkCmdY()[i] = c.getInStream().readSignedByte();
 }
 
  if (c.clickToTeleport)
 	firstStepY = c.getInStream().readSignedWordBigEndian();
 else
 	firstStepY = c.getInStream().readSignedWordBigEndian()-c.getMapRegionY()*8;
 c.setNewWalkCmdIsRunning(c.getInStream().readSignedByteC() == 1);
 for(int i1 = 0; i1 < c.newWalkCmdSteps; i1++) {
 	if (c.clickToTeleport) 
 		c.getPA().movePlayer(c.getNewWalkCmdX()[i1] + firstStepX, c.getNewWalkCmdY()[i1] + firstStepY, c.heightLevel);
 	c.getNewWalkCmdX()[i1] += firstStepX;
 	c.getNewWalkCmdY()[i1] += firstStepY;
 }

    }

}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: CTRL SHIFT CLICK Teleporting?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

A boolean cannot be an int
You need to check if it’s true:

if (c.clickToTeleport == true) // or this if (c.clickToTeleport)
or if it is false:

if (c.clickToTeleport == false) // or this if (!c.clickToTeleport)
